conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid through the baffles to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into.
Liquid flows from point A to points B and C.
Liquid flows through the openings in the baffles.
Liquid will flow into the container directly below the point where it exits the baffles.
Liquid exits through points A, B, and C, so it will flow into the container directly below these points.
Container E is directly below points A, B, and C.
Liquid will flow into container E.
